channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Domino's Partners with Nuro to Deliver Pizza via Driverless Vehicle
item.description: Chipotle invested in Nuro's $500 million Series C funding round last month and the company was just approved at the end of last year to begin testing on public roads in California. From a sales and drunk on High Life POV, Domino's pizza is the top pizza chain in the country.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators
item.description: (Dror Poleg)  Read: The future of work is a pyramid scheme, where every person sells his favorite person to the next person. Yesterday, Uber said total monthly bookings, which include ride-hailing and food delivery, hit record levels in March.  Khosrowshahi is high on the company's trajectory.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Ant Group Forced to Undergo Major Restructuring
item.description: It wasn't clear exactly why proceedings stopped but, the month before the planned offering, Jack Ma, the billionaire controlling shareholder of Ant and cofounder of Ant's sister company, Alibaba, criticized Chinese officials in a high-profile speech.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Will Smith's Upcoming Movie Pulls out of Georgia Over New Voting Law
item.description: Will Smith and director Antoine Fuqua announced yesterday they would pull production of their upcoming film out of Georgia because of the state's new controversial voting law.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Microsoft to Buy Speech Tech Company Nuance for $16B
item.description: Big picture: Microsoft worked on speech tech for years, but has had less success in the consumer market than Amazon or Google.    With Nuance, Microsoft scores a big list of healthcare clients + lots of speech data, which is important for building and fine-tuning those AI systems.  In the US, over half of physicians and three-quarters of hospitals use Nuance software.  This year, it reportedly dangled over $50 billion in front of Pinterest and is in talks to buy Discord for $10+ billion. The Nuance acquisition could catapult it ahead. er, nuance of human language.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Ant Group Forced to Undergo Major Restructuring
item.description: It wasn't clear exactly why proceedings stopped but, the month before the planned offering, Jack Ma, the billionaire controlling shareholder of Ant and cofounder of Ant's sister company, Alibaba, criticized Chinese officials in a high-profile speech.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: (Dror Poleg)  Read: The future of work is a pyramid scheme, where every person sells his favorite person to the next person. Yesterday, Uber said total monthly bookings, which include ride-hailing and food delivery, hit their highest levels ever in March.  Khosrowshahi is feeling high on the company's trajectory.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Microsoft to Buy Speech Tech Company Nuance for $16B
item.description: Big picture: Microsoft worked on speech tech for years, but has had less success in the consumer market than Amazon or Google.    With Nuance, Microsoft scores a big list of healthcare clients + lots of speech data, which is important for building and fine-tuning those AI systems.  In the US, over half of physicians and three-quarters of hospitals use Nuance software.  This year, it reportedly dangled over $50 billion in front of Pinterest and is in talks to buy Discord for $10+ billion. The Nuance acquisition could catapult it ahead. er, nuance of human language.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The Week Ahead: April 12
item.description: Economic data: The biggest report of the week is Tuesday’s Consumer Price Index, which will reveal how worried we should actually be about inflation.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 12
item.description: Quote: Chinese vaccines “don’t have very high protection rates.” (The Atlantic)   Read: America is about to go Botox wild.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Recapping the Busy Weekend in Sports Biz
item.description: Japan is very into golf—it has as many courses as the UK + Ireland combined. Golf history: With his victory at the Masters, Hideki Matsuyama became the first male Japanese golfer to win a major tournament. he’s selling it for $1.5 billion.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: CEOs Made More Than Ever In The Pandemic
item.description: Case in point: Paycom CEO Chad RichisonHe’s the newly crowned highest-paid CEO in the S&P 500 with a total compensation of $211 million in 2020.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Company Execs Meet at White House Over Chip Shortage
item.description: Sony said the chip shortage is the reason why there are so few PS5s available.  Senior execs from almost 20 companies are heading to the White House today to discuss the current chip shortage and ensure more supply chain chaos doesn’t break out in the future.  But it’s a big problemThe chip shortage has affected “virtually every major car company in recent months,” according to the WSJ, forcing automakers to halt production of their most popular cars. Those will take years and hundreds of billions worth of investments to resolve.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Recapping the Busy Weekend in Sports Biz
item.description: The Timberwolves are getting new owners: Fresh off losing a bidding war for the NY Mets, baseball star-turned-businessman Alex Rodriguez is teaming up with e-commerce legend Marc Lore to buy the NBA’s Minnesota Timberwolves and the WNBA’s Minnesota Lynx.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: (Defector)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: New York Raises Income Taxes on Super Wealthy, Raising Concerns Among Corporations
item.description: This week, state lawmakers passed a budget that raises the personal income tax on individuals making over $1 million and introduces two new brackets for those making more than $5 million and $25 million. That’s not a record some New Yorkers want to break250 business executives have sent a letter to state lawmakers arguing that higher taxes would “jeopardize New York’s recovery from the economic crisis inflicted by Covid-19” by sending high-net-worth people fleeing.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Biden Administration Releases Their $1.52 trillion Budget Proposal
item.description: Other highlights:$3 billion for immigration—an issue Biden recently caught flak for and handed over to VP Kamala Harris$2.7 billion for Amtrak, with most of that going to pay for better delay excuses23% increase in health spending and a record 40% increase for educationBottom line: Biden will have trouble passing this proposed budget because of a measly 1.7% increase to defense spending that already has GOP lawmakers grumbling.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Video Shows Elon Musk’s Neuralink-Chipped Monkey Play Pong With His Mind
item.description: Musk tweeted that later versions of this device could enable paraplegics to walk again.  Here’s the play-by-play: The monkey (ironically named Pager) moves his joystick to play the Pong game displayed on the screen. The Neuralink device analyzes Pager’s movements and begins to predict them.  Looking ahead...
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Vaccine Tracker: April 10
item.description: In the US…20% of Americans are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and a third of the population has received at least one dose, per the CDC.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Death of Two Notable Public Figures Friday Sparks Messages of Remembrance
item.description: Prince Philip, husband of Queen Elizabeth II, was the longest-serving royal spouse in British history. We lost two public figures yesterday: DMX and Prince Philip. He was 99 when he died yesterday at Windsor Castle. The Duke of Edinburgh. He was regarded as one of the biggest hip hop stars in the late 1990s and early 2000s.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Ask HR: Can I Eat During Zoom Meetings?
item.description: Not for nothing, you could probably get away with keeping your video off during a larger group meeting to eat food. During Covid, I've helped Morning Brew host trivia nights, socially distanced picnics, a virtual drag show, a magic show, and a virtual escape room, just to name a few. But if you feel nervous about eating your sushi on camera, then you might want to wait until after the awkward goodbye waves at the end of your meeting. Do you have any ideas for non-cringe virtual activities?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Big Ballot Showdown at the Arctic Circle
item.description: When Greenland pops up in the news, it means one of three things: a) global warming is getting worse, b) someone wants to buy it, or c) a dramatic election was just held over a rare earths mining project with implications for US national security. Expect the battle over Greenland, and within Greenland itself, to heat up in the next few years.  For the US: With China controlling over 70% of rare earth mining, the US is eyeing Greenland’s reserves (about 10% of the world’s rare earths) as a way to become less reliant on China for these critical raw materials. But like _____, there’s so much potential, and that’s what this election was all about. A lot is at stake For Greenland and for the US, China, Russia, or anyone else that considers themselves a global superpower.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Open House
item.description: Amenities include:5 beds, 4 bathsA pool surrounded by giant oak trees for secret pool parties (nothing weird, just secret)3 fireplacesA master bedroom with a sitting area, perfect for resting before a long night of sleepingHow much do you think it costs?
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 9
item.description: At a virtual roundtable Wednesday, billionaire investor and crypto bull Peter Thiel said he considers bitcoin a potential threat to the supremacy of the US dollar. (The Cut)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: CDC, Cruise Lines Spar Over Reopening
item.description: But to bring customers back, per CDC rules, cruise lines will have to... Carnival, Norwegian, and Royal Caribbean lost almost $7 billion last year. Norwegian, the first major US cruise line to publish reopening plans, said it will require them. Recommend vaccinations for everyone.  Run simulated voyages to rehearse safety procedures.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Biden Announces Executive Actions on Gun Control
item.description: Zoom out: Biden wants to prioritize the Covid-19 response and his infrastructure bill, but gun control has re-emerged as a policy focus following mass shootings in Atlanta, Boulder, and, most recently, Rock Hill, SC.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Amazon Leads Union 2:1 With About Half the Votes Counted
item.description: But for now, it appears as though Amazon may have dodged a labor organizing threat that would have rippled across the e-commerce industry.   As execs at Sears and Barnes & Noble can tell you, it’s virtually impossible to beat Amazon—and organizers trying to form the company’s first union at a US facility are finding that out. a legal battle could push off a conclusive result for weeks. NFL players and actors took up the cause as a civil rights issue, since most of the workers at the Bessemer facility are Black. Democrats including President Biden and Sen. Bernie Sanders voiced support, and so did some Republicans, like Sen. Marco Rubio. but by app.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Luxury Brands See Sales Boom Despite Pandemic
item.description: Zoom out: Even in a year of economic struggle for many, there are 660 more billionaires than there were a year ago.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: April 9
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Costco Food Courts Slowly Return to Normal Operation
item.description: It's one of the most famous perks that helps sell customers on the annual membership fee.  Zoom out: Costco's bargain food-court eats have a cult following that makes In-n-Out's not-so-secret secret menu jealous.
item.author: Alex Hickey
